chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey Christopher Kowalewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.
  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable Court costs, fees, and surcharges, domestic abuse surcharge..  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two. Credit for 92 days.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with the victim, however can be modifed only at the probation department's discretion.

Comply with the standard rules for domestic abuse Extended Supervision.
Complete a Batterers Intervention Program and a parenting class.
Coperte and participate with a domestic abuse assessment and follow any recommended treatment.

Copeerate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.
*Conditions apply to counts one and two.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (52 pages) commencing MAY 20, 2015 received and filed.kl

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE DONALD FOR JUDGE DALLET.....
Defendant Corey Christopher Kowalewski in court IN CUSTODY with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by victim, Sarah N.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS, concurrent to Count #2.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR.
Credit for 92 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS, concurrent to Count #1.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR.
Credit for 92 days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

**Court finds that these domestic are domestic abuse violations, therefore, these incidents qualify as acts of domestic abuse and for application of the domestic abuse surcharge.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2):
* Comply with the standard rules for domestic abuse extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim, however, can be modified ONLY AT THE PROBATION DEPARTMENT'S DISCRETION.
* Complete a batterer's intervention program.
* Complete a parenting class.
* Cooperate and participate with a domestic abuse assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the domestic abuse surcharge.  The Court ordered that the domestic abuse surcharge to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Federal firearms warning given.
Appeal rights given.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE DONALD FOR JUDGE DALLET.....
Defendant Corey Christopher Kowalewski in court IN CUSTODY with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court dismissed both habitual criminality penalty enhancers.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered both domestic abuse repeater penalty enhancers to remain in place.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

**Due to the Domestic Abuse Repeater penalty enhancer, Counts 1 & 2 are felony convictions.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
